metadata.name: Global Motivation Scale — Bookends Adaptation
metadata.authors: Guay, F., Mageau, G. A., & Vallerand, R. J.
metadata.citation: Guay, F., Mageau, G. A., & Vallerand, R. J. (2003). On the hierarchical structure of self-determined motivation: A test of top-down and bottom-up effects. Personality and Social Psychology Bulletin, 29(8), 992-1004.
metadata.license: Published instrument (GMS-28). Bookends adaptation selects 10 items from SDT continuum endpoints (IM, ER, Amotivation).

items.text: ...for the pleasure of learning new, interesting things.
...for the pleasure I feel mastering what I am doing.
...because I do not want to disappoint certain people.
...because I want to be viewed more positively by certain people.
...in order to show others what I am capable of.
...although I do not see the benefit in what I am doing.
...although it does not make a difference whether I do them or not.
...even though I do not have a good reason for doing them.

validation.sample_description: GMS-28 full scale alphas from Guay et al. (2003); Bookends subset alphas estimated from parent subscales. IM alpha averaged across 3 IM subtypes (Knowledge α=.84, Accomplishment α=.85, Stimulation α=.86). ER and Amot from full 4-item subscales; 3-4 item subset may differ.
